revision.comment: /* Sample log entries */ fix link titles
revision.text:
{{shortcut|WB:FILTER}} {{edit filter navigation}} The '''[[Special:AbuseFilter|Edit filter]]''' is a tool used to allow trusted users to set specific controls on user activity and create automated reactions for certain behaviors. The [[mw:Extension:AbuseFilter|Abuse Filter extension]] was developed by [[w:User:Werdna|Werdna]] with support from the Wikimedia Foundation, and went live on the English Wikibooks in August 2010. Nearly all user-facing elements of the filter refer to it as the "Edit filter" as not all the edits it flags are abusive. In the software and special pages it retains its original name. The extension allows automatic filters/heuristics to be applied to all edits. Specific rules can be developed, such as "users with fewer than 500 edits are blocked from moving pages to titles which match this regular expression: /poop/". Of course, the rules can get quite a bit more complicated. Log entries and filters are viewable by autoconfirmed users. For all filters, including those hidden from public view, a brief, general summary of what the rule targets will be available, and displayed in the log, the list of active filters, and in any error messages generated by the filter. Implementation of AbuseFilter on Wikibooks is being done with due caution—most edit filters should be tested for a few days (in "log only" mode) before being brought to full force ("warn", "disallow", or "throttle" modes). Only administrators are allowed to modify any of the filters. == Extension documentation == === Filtering criteria === For all of the following, we can do extensive normalization, regex matching, length comparison and regular comparisons (less than, greater than, equal to) matching, combining different filters with Boolean logic. ==== User ==== * Edit count. * Account age. * Groups. * Email-confirmed status. ==== Titles (moved-to, moved from included) ==== * Namespace. * Title. * Full text. * Restrictions and protection status. ==== Action ==== * The action type (edit, move or createaccount). * Edit summary. * Contents of the edit. ==== Throttling ==== *Filters can specify whether actions done at a certain rate are by the same IP address, account, /16 range, account-creation-date, and/or to the same page, for a consequence (below) to be invoked. * Any of the above conditions can be combined to produce a separate rate-limiter. For instance, we can group all accounts created on the same date, from the same /16, for the purposes of rate-limiting. * Any actions set for that filter will occur if, and only if, the rate-limiter is tripped. This reduces false-positives by making the filter apply only if the same user is consistently tripping a particular filter, rather than a single false-positive. === Actions which can be assigned in response to filtered edits === If a user triggers a filter, the edit filter can apply any of the following sanctions based on the severity of the offense: * All actions triggering a filter are logged at a special page. * The user's action can be tagged for further review. * The user can be warned that their actions may be unconstructive. * The user's action may be disallowed. * The user's account may have its autoconfirmed status removed. The following actions are currently not available on this wiki: * The user's account may be blocked from editing, along with all IP addresses used in the last 7 days. * The user's account may be removed from all privileged groups (such as sysop or bot). Note: Individual sanctions can be disabled selectively. Any administrator can [[Special:AbuseFilter/tools|restore autoconfirmed status]] in case of an error. === Monitoring === All edits triggering an action will produce a report at [[Special:AbuseLog]]. On this page, a brief log entry is entered. Users with the appropriate permissions may view the log summary. Administrators may view details on the log entry. This includes all information available to the filter when it ran, and may be useful for debugging purposes. CheckUsers may view private data about the action which caused the log event, such as the user's IP address. The edit can also be tested against another existing or proposed filter via an "examine" link. ==== Sample log entries ==== [[Image:AbuseLog-Sample.png|thumb|A sample detailed log entry]] * 06:43, 23 June 2008: [[User:Example|Example]] ([[User talk:Example|discuss]] | [[Special:Contributions/Example|contribs]] | [[Special:Block/Example|block]]) triggered filter 1, making an edit on [[Main Page]]. Actions taken: Warn, disallow; Filter description: Test Filter (details | examine) * 06:43, 23 June 2008: [[User:Example|Example]] ([[User talk:Example|discuss]] | [[Special:Contributions/Example|contribs]] | [[Special:Block/Example|block]]) triggered filter 2, making an edit on [[Main Page]]. Actions taken: None; Filter description: Test Filter (details | examine) * 06:42, 23 June 2008: [[User:Example|Example]] ([[User talk:Example|discuss]] | [[Special:Contributions/Example|contribs]] | [[Special:Block/Example|block]]) triggered filter 1, making an edit on [[Main Page]]. Actions taken: Warn; Filter description: Test Filter (details | examine) * 06:42, 23 June 2008: [[User:Example|Example]] ([[User talk:Example|discuss]] | [[Special:Contributions/Example|contribs]] | [[Special:Block/Example|block]]) triggered filter 2, making an edit on [[Main Page]]. Actions taken: None; Filter description: Test Filter (details | examine) * 06:22, 23 June 2008: [[User:Example|Example]] ([[User talk:Example|discuss]] | [[Special:Contributions/Example|contribs]] | [[Special:Block/Example|block]]) triggered filter 1, making an edit on [[Main Page]]. Actions taken: Warn, Disallow; Filter description: Test Filter (details | examine) * 06:22, 23 June 2008: [[User:Example|Example]] ([[User talk:Example|discuss]] | [[Special:Contributions/Example|contribs]] | [[Special:Block/Example|block]]) triggered filter 2, making an edit on [[Main Page]]. Actions taken: None; Filter description: Test Filter (details | examine) The details link brings up a screen like that on the right. === Safeguards === To protect the wiki against poorly configured filters, a technical limit is imposed on the maximum percentage of actions that will trigger a given filter. Other technical limits are in the process of being written. === Notification === All notifications are based on the template {{[[template:edit filter warning|edit filter warning]]}}. Standard notifications shown to a user triggering a filter '''action''': {| class=wikitable ! Message name ! Message text |- | [[MediaWiki:abusefilter-disallowed|abusefilter-disallowed]] | {{MediaWiki:abusefilter-disallowed}} |- | [[MediaWiki:abusefilter-degrouped|abusefilter-degrouped]] | {{MediaWiki:abusefilter-degrouped}} |- | [[MediaWiki:abusefilter-autopromote-blocked|abusefilter-autopromote-blocked]] | {{MediaWiki:abusefilter-autopromote-blocked}} |} Generic '''warning''' message is below. Administrators are advised to use custom warnings. {| class=wikitable ! Message name ! Message text |- | [[MediaWiki:abusefilter-warning|abusefilter-warning]] | {{MediaWiki:abusefilter-warning}} |} Some existing filters and their warnings: {| class=wikitable ! Filter and message ! Message text |- style="vertical-align:top;" | [[Special:AbuseFilter/1|1: large deletions]]

[[MediaWiki:abusefilter-warning-removal|removal]] | {{MediaWiki:abusefilter-warning-removal}} |- style="vertical-align:top;" | [[Special:AbuseFilter/3|3: link spamming]]

[[MediaWiki:abusefilter-warning-link-spam|possible link spam]] | {{MediaWiki:Abusefilter-warning-link-spam}} |} If a filter is set to warn and disallow, then a user clicking "Save page" will alternatively see that warning and standard [[MediaWiki:Abusefilter-disallowed|disallowed]] message. ==Known issues== When the extension is initially installed, the available actions will '''not''' include blocking or removing from privileged groups. This restricted usage has been determined by community consensus, and if the extension is successful, the community may decide to enable the block, rangeblock or degroup actions for use on this wiki. [[Category:Wikibooks edit filter| ]]

{{mbox |style=text-align:center; |image=none |type=notice |text=[[Special:AbuseFilter|'''Edit filter management''']]
[[Wikibooks:Edit filter|Documentation]]{{·}} [[Wikibooks talk:Edit filter|Discussion]]{{·}} [[Wikibooks:Edit filter/Instructions|How to create a filter]]{{·}} [[Wikibooks:Edit filter/Requested|Requested edit filters]]{{·}} [[Wikibooks:Edit filter/False positives|Reporting false positives]]{{·}} [[Wikibooks:Tags|Tags]] }}[[Category:Wikibooks header templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{edit filter navigation}} {{warning|[[Wikibooks:Edit filter|Edit filter]]s are very powerful tools - do not underestimate the damage errors can cause. If you're new to this, make sure you get appropriate input from editors more experienced with edit filters.}} == Creating a filter == This section explains how to create a filter with some preliminary testing, so you don't flood the [[Special:AbuseFilter/history|history page]]. * Read documentation at [[mw:Extension:AbuseFilter/RulesFormat]] * Test some expressions at [[Special:AbuseFilter/tools|debugging tools]]: *: for example, evaluate 'some string' rlike 'myregexp' to test your regexp; *: true expression evaluates to 1, false shows nothing * Manually test your code at [[Special:AbuseFilter/test|batch testing]] page: *: find someone who recently made an edit that you're trying to target, *: put that username in "Changes by user" field and click "test" button; *: if you don't see positive triggers: *:: check "show changes that do not match the filter" and click "test" again *:: find the edit that you targeted and click on "(details)" *:: check the variables and maybe return back to [[Special:AbuseFilter/tools|debugging tools]] * [[Special:AbuseFilter/new|Create]] idle (logging only) filter *: in the notes field add something like "Testing phase, will add a warning" *: let the idle filter run for a while to test for false positives and negatives * Post a message at [[Wikibooks talk:Edit filter]], so other administrators have a chance to fix your code or improve the warning * Finally, fully enable your filter, e.g. add warning, prevention, tagging, etc == Controlling efficiency == Because these filters are run on every single edit, a poorly worded filter has the strong potential to severely slow down editing or even cause some larger pages to time out. However, some very minor changes in how the conditions are ordered can greatly decrease the running time of the filters. Making use of the order of operations in this way can make the difference between a good filter and one that must be disabled for performance reasons. === Order of operations === Operations are generally done left-to-right, but there is an order to which they are resolved. As soon as the filter fails one of the conditions, it will stop checking the rest of them (due to [[w:short-circuit evaluation|short-circuit evaluation]]) and move on to the next filter. The evaluation order is: # Anything surrounded by parentheses (( and )) is evaluated as a single unit. # Turning variables/literals into their respective data. (i.e., article_namespace to 0) # Function calls (norm, lcase, etc.) # Unary + and - (i.e. -1234, +1234) # Keywords # Boolean inversion (!x) # Exponentiation (2**3 → 8) # Multiplication-related (multiplication, division, modulo) # Comparisons. (<, >, ==) # Boolean operations. (&, |, ^, in) === Making expensive operations cheaper === When using keywords such as rlike, in, or contains, the filter must go through the entire string variable to look for the string you're searching for. Variables such as old_wikitext have the tendency to be very large. Sometimes you will be able to approximate these variables by using smaller ones such as added_lines or removed_lines, which the filter can process much faster. Also, using a check for old_size can also help to ensure that you're not going to even try checking a large block of wikitext. You should always order your filters so that the condition that will knock out the largest number of edits is first. Usually this is a user groups or a user edit count check; in general, the last condition should be the regex that is actually looking for the sort of vandalism you're targeting. [[Category:Wikibooks edit filter|Instructions]]
[[Category:Wikibooks administration|Edit filter]]

revision.comment: /* Large Scale Hidden IP Vandalism */ strike AGF, assume nothing
revision.text:
{{edit filter navigation}} [[Category:Wikibooks edit filter|Requested]] This page is for non-administrators or people without sufficient knowledge about the coding involved to make requests to enact edit filters. Please add a new section ''at the top'' of current requests using the following format: 
==Filter name==
*'''Task''': What is the filter supposed to do? To what pages and editors does it apply?
*'''Reason''': Why is the filter needed.
- ~~~~
Bear the following in mind: * Filters are applied to ''all'' edits. Therefore, problematic changes that apply to a single page are likely not suitable for an edit filter. * Each filter takes time to run, making editing (and to some extent other things) slightly slower. The time is only a few milliseconds per filter, but with enough filters that adds up. * There is a limit to what filters can check for. More complex, non-essential tasks, such as those that need to perform a more in-depth check of the page or fetch information that the filter system does not have access to, are better served by separate software, run by an individual user on their own machine, or dedicated server such as the Toolserver, rather than those used to actually host Wikibooks. * It is not called the '''abuse''' filter for a reason. Contributors are not expected to have read every policy, guideline, and style page. Trivial formatting mistakes and edits that at first glance look fine but go against some obscure style guideline or convention are not suitable candidates for an edit filter—quite apart from performance concerns, if it doesn't harm the project, it is best not to hassle new contributors because of it. * For prevention of creation of pages with certain names, [[MediaWiki:Titleblacklist]] is usually a better way to handle the problem. == Poop vandalism == *'''Task''': detect "Poop" vandalism *'''Reason''': A major abuse filter on enwiki. [http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Wikijunior:Ancient_Civilizations/Norse&diff=prev&oldid=1932230 I reverted an instance of poop vandalism]. I have a filter from test wikipedia you can use. '''—[[User:I-20|I-20]][[User talk:I-20|the highway]]''' 20:58, 12 September 2010 (UTC) **We do have a filter, but it needs more words. '''—[[User:I-20|I-20]][[User talk:I-20|the highway]]''' 21:01, 12 September 2010 (UTC) ***The filter at test.wikipedia.org is hidden. I'll be happy to make any additions you'd like. Our filter is visible, so you should be able to analyze where we are lacking from your end. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] 01:18, 13 September 2010 (UTC) ****I know it's hidden. I can send the filter via email. '''—[[User:I-20|I-20]][[User talk:I-20|the highway]]''' 00:55, 15 September 2010 (UTC) == Large Scale Hidden IP Vandalism == See the discussion at the bottom of my Talk Page. It seems there has been some strange vandalism where large amounts of seemingly normal text have been added to pages by IP users which mostly consists of text copied from Wikipedia with some useful parts left in. It's gone undetected mostly. Would it be easy to set up an edit filter which warns or doesn't permit when an IP user adds more than, say, 10,000 bytes?--[[User:Xania|ЗAНИA]] [[Image:Flag_of_Estonia.svg|15px]][[User talk:Xania|talk]] 22:15, 18 March 2013 (UTC) : New edits can do this. Filters cannot be applied to old edits though. I think tagging the edits as "big edits" should be the way to go and should be applied to everyone, not just IP users. Big edits can then be easily examined by everyone. Some registered users have copied text from Wikipedia and other websites at times too. No telling how many of those have gone undetected as well. --[[User:Darklama|dark]][[User_talk:Darklama|lama]] 00:28, 19 March 2013 (UTC) ::The suggestion by Dirk is that this is vandalism rather than cases of unknowledgeable editors and it seems to be only IP editors.--[[User:Xania|ЗAНИA]] [[Image:Flag_of_Estonia.svg|15px]][[User talk:Xania|talk]] 07:20, 19 March 2013 (UTC) :::A filter will find 10,000 bytes by an unknowledgeable IP editor with good intentions, an IP editor who waited until they had a lot written before submitting their work, and vandalism. I think AGF assuming nothing and letting things slip through is better than assuming its all bad. Applying a tag will allow all to be found, and people to address only those situations where there is an actual problem. --[[User:Darklama|dark]][[User_talk:Darklama|lama]] 13:26, 19 March 2013 (UTC) :::: The ideal, of course, is not to AGF but rather (taking a tip from Wikinews :-) to not ABF. But the point is well made. --[[User:Pi zero|Pi zero]] ([[User talk:Pi zero|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Pi zero|contribs]]) 17:47, 19 March 2013 (UTC)

revision.comment: change heading level to match refactored false positives page
revision.text: =={{{username|Username}}}== ;Username : {{user|{{{username|Username}}}}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:{{{username|Username}}}}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : {{#ifexist: {{page}}| [[{{page}}]]| [[{{{page|Page not specified}}}]] }} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:{{{page|Page not specified}}}}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : {{{description|Please replace this with a description of the edit you were trying to make.}}} ;Date and time : {{{datetime|<includeonly>~~</includeonly><includeonly>~~</includeonly><includeonly>~</includeonly><noinclude><nowiki>~~~~~</nowiki></noinclude>}}} ;Comments <!-- Please leave this area blank for now, but be prepared to answer questions left by reviewing editors. Thanks! --> <noinclude> {{documentation}} </noinclude>

{{Documentation subpage}} === Usage === {{tlxs|Falsepositive|Your username|The page you were trying to edit|A description of what you were trying to do}}
OR
{{tlxs|Falsepositive|Your username|The page you were trying to edit|A description of what you were trying to do|The time you tried to make the edit}} '''This is not the place to report a false positive of the [[WB:Edit filter|Edit filter]].''' Please use this template as directed at [[Wikibooks:Edit filter/False positives]] instead. Thanks! [[Category:Wikibooks namespace templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

Instructions Before reporting, please be aware that if you were doing something stupid or something you shouldn't have been doing, and the system stopped you, posting about it here is likely to get you blocked into the bargain. If you still want to report a false positive, please follow the following steps: #Look for the instructions marked by <-- and --> #Fill in the information where instructed #'''Do not fill in the field for Subject/headline''' #Click the ''save page'' button at the bottom
[[Category:Template subpages|{{PAGENAME}}]]

revision.comment: [[WB:REVERT|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/5.150.100.31|5.150.100.31]] ([[User talk:5.150.100.31|talk]]) to last version by QuiteUnusual
revision.text:
{{edit filter navigation}} [[Category:Wikibooks edit filter|False positives]]
'''{{plain link|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Wikibooks:Edit_filter/False_positives&action=edit§ion=new&preload=Template:Falsepositive/Preload&editintro=Template:Falsepositive/Editintro|NAME=Click here to report a false positive}}'''
==Rmhsu== ;Username : {{user|Rmhsu}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Rmhsu}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Structural Biochemistry/Chromatography/Thin Layer]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Structural Biochemistry/Chromatography/Thin Layer}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I was editing a wikibooks page on thin layer chromatography under the major headline of structural biochemistry. This contribution in which I was attempting to make was to include a little more information about the retardation factor between a solvent and a compound of interest in climbing up a silica based gel. This contribution also included a descriptive picture, as well as a formula in which to actually calculate the retardation factor. ;Date and time : 07:35, 23 October 2010 (UTC) ;Comments It was the "retardation factor" that triggered the filter due to it trying to detect vandalism with the word "retard" in it. I've adjusted the filter so that it should not affect you again. I also added the text to the page you were attempting to add. Sorry for the inconvenience. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] 13:05, 23 October 2010 (UTC) ==Aveilleux== ;Username : {{user|Aveilleux}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Aveilleux}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Polymorphic Data Structures in C/Function Invocation]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Polymorphic Data Structures in C/Function Invocation}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I was attempting to edit the page [[Polymorphic Data Structures in C/Function Invocation]] to create the page, but my edit was disallowed. The current version of the page is located at [[User:Aveilleux/_Sandbox]]. ;Date and time : 21:45, 3 November 2010 (UTC) ;Comments :I've moved the page from your userspace into the book. I will look at the edit filter to check why it was triggered. Thanks. [[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']] [[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]] 22:16, 3 November 2010 (UTC) :It was triggering because of the "[]" in the code, which was triggering the "test edit" filter, as the "[]" is a result of one of the buttons you see below the edit box. Sometimes vandals will go and try to edit a page and hit a bunch of the toolbar buttons. That filter was designed to catch that. I removed the portion of it that would look for the "[]" since I see it's used often in C++ code. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] 00:48, 4 November 2010 (UTC) ==Mcld== ;Username : {{user|Mcld}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Mcld}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Puredyne/SSH_into_your_Puredyne_system]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Puredyne/SSH_into_your_Puredyne_system}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : Editing a page about using SSH connections, I added a simple SSH connection command, like this: 
ssh live@192.168.1.74
Clearly that looks a bit like an email address, though it didn't occur to me until the filter shouted at me. I don't know if there's a way to distinguish this from email address entry, so I'm not sure it'll be possible to fix this false positive; but I'm reporting it FYI. Thanks. ;Date and time : 09:47, 11 November 2010 (UTC) ;Comments Hmm... this would be tricky to distinguish from a email address, perhaps we can check to see if a line begins with 'ssh', 'scp', 'sftp', etc. —Preceding [[w:Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Thenub314|Thenub314]] ([[User talk:Thenub314|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Thenub314|contribs]]) 18:15, 11 November 2010 (UTC) I've tweaked the filter to be more like the link spam test and made it only add a tag for manual checking. --[[User:Darklama|dark]][[User_talk:Darklama|lama]] 19:36, 11 November 2010 (UTC) ==Rivardau== ;Username : {{user|Rivardau}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Rivardau}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Peanuts (card game)]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Peanuts (card game)}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : adding a new how-to-play rules book about a card game that i love to play with my family ;Date and time : 22:19, 29 November 2010 (UTC) ;Comments :Please refrain from including [[File:Example.jpg]] in your edits. If you do not have an image available, there is no need for a placeholder. Additionally, I would suggest placing a link at [[Card Games/List]] following the same convention you see on the page already, making the content you wanted to add a "subpage" of the [[Card Games]] book. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] 23:33, 29 November 2010 (UTC) ==72.152.244.244== ;Username : {{user|72.152.244.244}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:72.152.244.244}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Jeep Liberty/Performance]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Jeep_Liberty/Performance}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : This is a discussion of performance enhancements available for the Jeep Liberty. The last sentence of the paragraph currently states that there is only one vendor of ECU flash updates for the Liberty Diesel. Having been investigating this update for my Liberty, I am aware of at least one other vendor of ECU flash updates: Green Diesel Engineering. I edited the last sentence to read as follows: "The ECU on the 2.8L CRD is made by Bosch, and at this time there are at least two companies offering a re-flash for the CRD ECU: one is [http://www.greendieselengineering.com Green Diesel Engineering] and the other is [http://www.inmotionusa.com INMOTION TUNING]." However, when I attempted to save this edited sentence, it was flagged by the automatic program as being Unconstructive. Note: Regrettably, due to problems with the login program, I was unable to login with my Wikipedia username, Biscuiteater57, nor was I able to register separately under my Wikipedia username (which I prefer to do). I received error messages that the username already exists in the unified user login, but also that the username does not exist. I have submitted a trouble ticket about this problem. ;Date and time : 02:18, 10 June 2011 (UTC) ;Comments :Looks like you have made your edits now. You had added ''Italic text'' in your edit, which is what you get when you click the italic link in the toolbar but don't actually apply it to text. Many times people will test the software and just click buttons, so that's what triggered it. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|discuss]] 12:06, 10 June 2011 (UTC) ==72.205.8.79== ;Username : {{user|72.205.8.79}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:72.205.8.79}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Scouting/BSA]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Scouting/BSA}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : some meritbadge requiremens were not ther and were just red I was trying to show them to another page that as all of the requirments ;Date and time : 23:33, 17 June 2011 (UTC) ;Comments :You tried to make edits that were distorting headings on the page and left "== Heading text ==" and "'''Bold text'''" on the page from clicking the toolbar for bold and headings without modifying their default values. Please see [[Help:Editing]] and this will improve the appearance of your edits and avoid edits being flagged as test edit from the toolbar. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|discuss]] 14:50, 18 June 2011 (UTC) ==188.140.132.234== ;Username : {{user|188.140.132.234}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:188.140.132.234}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Chess Opening Theory/1. c4/1...e5/2. Nc3/2...Nf6]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Chess Opening Theory/1. c4/1...e5/2. Nc3/2...Nf6}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I was editing the page > the content under the title "McComiskey" (McComiskey, Bruce. "Disassembling Plato's Critique of Rhetoric in the Gorgias (447a-466a)." Rhetoric Review 11 (1992): 79-90. McComiskey concurs that Plato scholars do not contest Plato’s disdain for the sophists. However, Plato’s treatment of sophist rhetoric, particularly that of Gorgias, the Leontini rhetorician, divides scholars: some—Kathleen Freeman, Terence Irwin, and W.H. Thompson among others—read Plato’s treatment of Gorgias the sophist as fair and accurate; conversely, McComiskey, drawing his argument from extant fragments of Gorgias, sees these views as distorted and unfounded. Plato presents this distorted view of Gorgias’ rhetoric to gain the favor of an audience leery of anti-democratic sentiments. Plato’s audience would have memories of the tyranny of the Four Hundred and of the tyranny of the Thirty freshly in mind. These bloody revolts temporary supplanted Greek democracy with a Socrates-Plato endorsed oligarchy. Gorgias the sophist supported democracy; thus, Plato’s readers were unlikely to accept Socrates’ “defeat” of Gorgias if Plato did not depict Gorgias’ rhetoric in a conflicting and absurd light. McComiskey explains that unlike Socrates and Plato whose epistemology is foundational, based on some “external reality or immutable truth” against which to compare, to weigh impressions, Gorgias the sophist adheres to a relativistic epistemology based on the kairotic , the opportune, moment. Since human’s understanding of reality is filtered through the distortion of our senses, a kairotic moment is necessary to “unite disparate subjective” images (205). McComiskey concludes that Plato’s rendering of Gorgias’ rhetoric could never be supported by Gorgias’ the sophist’s relativistic epistemology.) ;Date and time : 21:07, 28 August 2011 (UTC) ;Comments :In the text being added was ":Indented line" which triggers this edit filter as it appears to be a test edit. If you remove this line the edit will succeed. Note, it doesn't appear in the content you pasted here, but it does appear in the edit filter log. Thanks [[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']] [[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]] 22:28, 28 August 2011 (UTC) ==Panic2k4== ;Username : {{user|Panic2k4}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Panic2k4}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[User:Panic2k4/Sandbox/DumpingGround]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:User:Panic2k4/Sandbox/DumpingGround}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I was cleaning and moving content between my pages. It triggered a filter. Can reviewers be excluded from the filter ? (Or/And users editing their own userspace) ;Date and time : 23:48, 22 September 2011 (UTC) ;Comments There is a lack of information on what filter was triggered on the event log. --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Panic2k4|contribs]]) 00:01, 23 September 2011 (UTC) :Ha, the "Specific-page vandalism" bit on the log is the "identity" of the filter [[Special:AbuseFilter]]. --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Panic2k4|contribs]]) 01:48, 23 September 2011 (UTC) I think it was the URL spam (copy paste of a section of links I had on another page) the filter will not detect commutative edits (of the same content), I've completed the action and I doubt that a change in the filter would be required or result in improvement (even so a reviewer should be considered trustworthy enough to be excluded from this type of spam detection, or at least susceptible to engage in constructive dialog if any deviation is detected, and it would be ground to have the reviewer status removed). --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Panic2k4|contribs]]) 00:13, 23 September 2011 (UTC) :Don't panic. Pun intended. Was a syntax error in a filter that Darklama has helpfully corrected. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|discuss]] 00:52, 23 September 2011 (UTC) ==93.65.1.207== ;Username : {{user|93.65.1.207}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:93.65.1.207}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't I need to save the latest modifications. ;Date and time : 06:02, 10 December 2011 (UTC) ;Comments ==64.33.154.90== ;Username : {{user|64.33.154.90}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:64.33.154.90}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Game Maker Programming/Variables]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Game Maker Programming/Variables}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : ;Date and time : 23:56, 30 March 2012 (UTC) ;Comments the page is blank :Looks like it has content to me. Why do you keep trying to remove all the content? – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|discuss]] 04:15, 31 March 2012 (UTC) ==186.114.61.186== ;Username : {{user|186.114.61.186}} ({{plainlinks|URL=https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:186.114.61.186}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing (don't wikilink) : [[Structural Biochemistry/Protein function/Antibodies]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Structural Biochemistry/Protein function/Antibodies}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Structural_Biochemistry/Protein_function/Antibodies&action=submit ;Date and time : 22:42, 15 April 2012 (UTC) ;Comments Antibody: An immunoglobulin, a specialized immune protein, produced because of the introduction of an antigen into the body, and which possesses the remarkable ability to combine with the very antigen that triggered its production. ==66.30.95.45== ;Username : {{user|66.30.95.45}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:66.30.95.45}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : [[Parkour/Basic Moves/Underbar]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Parkour/Basic Moves/Underbar}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I had seen a video of how to do the move, and I thought the description in the article was faulty. That's why the moves's called an ''Under''bar, not ''Over''bar. ;Date and time : 04:39, 22 July 2012 (UTC) ;Comments :I've applied the edit that you were attempting to make. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|discuss]] 12:30, 22 July 2012 (UTC) ==Flyoffacliff== ;Username : {{user|Flyoffacliff}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Flyoffacliff}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : [[Talk:How to use a Motorola DVR]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Talk:How to use a Motorola DVR}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I am try to blank this page, because their is only one question on it, and it is almost 4 years old, and whoever asked the question does not have an account and did not sign it. ;Date and time : 20:42, 2 August 2012 (UTC) ;Comments :Blanking pages is not the correct way to proceed. You either need to add {{tlx|delete}} to the page to request speedy deletion or raise a [[WB:RFD|request for deletion]] [[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']] [[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]] 21:39, 2 August 2012 (UTC) ==86.112.45.225== ;Username : {{user|86.112.45.225}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:86.112.45.225}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : Create account ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Create account}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I am a user on Wikipedia. I tried to create an account here using my Wikipedia user name and a different password. Whatever I try I get Login error: An automated filter has identified this edit as potentially unconstructive. I cannot see that I am doing anything incorrectly - I enter the Captcha word, my Wikipedia user name, a strong password in excess of 12 characters, confirm it and then enter a valid e-mail address. I have closed the Wikibooks tab on my browser and reopened but this makes no difference. ;Date and time : 14:16, 19 September 2012 (UTC) Apologies, please disregard this request. I have just found out about account unification and set it up successfully. It has been several years since I last looked at My Preferences in Wikipedia - having just viewed it, I got the clue as to what to do. ;Comments ==Benjitheijneb== ;Username : {{user|Benjitheijneb}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Benjitheijneb}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : [[User:Benjitheijneb]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:User:Benjitheijneb}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : Trying to create a user page in line with those on my other Wikimedia Foundation wikis (though with differences as per the different wiki). ;Date and time : 17:31, 23 October 2012 (UTC) ;Comments :Looks like the number of external links you were adding in one go triggered the anti-spam abuse filter. I've now created the page for you. The problem can be avoided by creating the page with no links, then adding them one by one. But you weren't to know that! Apologies, and welcome to Wikibooks. [[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']] [[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]] 17:58, 23 October 2012 (UTC) ==Janus Kannuberg== ;Username : {{user|Janus Kannuberg}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Janus Kannuberg}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : [[Main Page]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Main Page}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I wanted wikibooks to have black background and pasted code from here: http://blog.obelisk.ro/2010/08/wikipedia-black-background-with-syntax.html. I worked, like on Wikipedia but this time an error message came. ;Date and time : 22:26, 10 December 2012 (UTC) ;Comments ==Rajmaan== ;Username : {{user|Rajmaan}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Rajmaan}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : [[User:Rajmaan/Jurchen]] ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:User:Rajmaan/Jurchen}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I was creating a user subpage to work on a Jurchen, Chinese and English glossary. Thank you again. --[[User:Awagner|Awagner]] ([[User talk:Awagner|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Awagner|contribs]]) 14:53, 10 May 2014 (UTC) ==Gmjenks== ;Username : {{user|Gmjenks}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:Gmjenks}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : {{#ifexist: {{page}}| [[{{page}}]]| [[Python_Programming/Sorted_Container_Types]] }} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:Python_Programming/Sorted_Container_Types}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : Trying to create this page: == Maintaining Sort Order == Python does not provide modules like C++'s set and map data types as part of its standard library. This is a concious decision on the part of Guido, et al to preserve "one obvious way to do it." Instead Python delegates this task to third-party libraries that are available on the [https://pypi.python.org/pypi Python Package Index]. These libraries use various techniques to maintain list, dict, and set types in sorted order. Maintaining order using a specialized data structure can avoid very slow behavior (quadratic run-time) in the naive approach of editing and constantly re-sorting. Several implementations are described here. * [http://www.grantjenks.com/docs/sortedcontainers/ Python SortedContainers Module] - Pure-Python implementation that is fast-as-C implementations. Implements sorted list, dict, and set data types. Testing includes 100% code coverage and hours of stress. Documentation includes full API reference, [http://www.grantjenks.com/docs/sortedcontainers/performance.html performance comparison], and contributing/development guidelines. * [https://pypi.python.org/pypi/rbtree Python rbtree Module] - Provides a fast, C-implementation for dict and set data types. Based on a red-black tree implementation. * [https://pypi.python.org/pypi/treap Python treap Module] - Provides a sorted dict data type. Uses a treap for implementation and improves performance using Cython. * [https://pypi.python.org/pypi/bintrees Python bintrees Module] - Provides several tree-based implementations for dict and set data types. Fastest implementations are based on AVL and Red-Black trees. Implemented in C. Extends the conventional API to provide set operations for dict data types. * [https://pypi.python.org/pypi/Banyan Python banyan Module] - Provides a fast, C-implementation for dict and set data types. * [https://pypi.python.org/pypi/skiplistcollections Python skiplistcollections Module] - Pure-Python implementation based on skip-lists providing a limited API for dict and set data types. * [https://pypi.python.org/pypi/blist Python blist Module] - Provides sorted list, dict and set data types based on the "blist" data type, a B-tree implementation. Implemented in Python and C. ;Date and time : 23:03, 9 May 2014 (UTC) ;Comments ==62.3.239.168== ;Username : {{user|62.3.239.168}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:62.3.239.168}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : {{#ifexist: {{page}}| [[{{page}}]]| [[http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/QBasic/Appendix]] }} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/QBasic/Appendix}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : add SHELL command description ;Date and time : 08:56, 25 May 2014 (UTC) ;Comments ==ElisaTrippetti== ;Username : {{user|ElisaTrippetti}} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchUser={{urlencode:ElisaTrippetti}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Page you were editing : {{#ifexist: {{page}}| [[{{page}}]]| [[https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Wikibooks:Reading_room/Archives/2009/August#Translation_of_an_exitsting_Wikibook]] }} ({{plainlinks|URL=http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Special:AbuseLog?title=Special:AbuseLog&wpSearchTitle={{urlencode:https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Wikibooks:Reading_room/Archives/2009/August#Translation_of_an_exitsting_Wikibook}}|NAME=filter log}}) ;Description : I was trying to correct a grammatical error. ;Date and time : 21:36, 14 July 2014 (UTC) ;Comments :The page you are trying to edit is an archived of old discussions - we do not edit them and the filters are there to prevent this happening. == Welcome message == Hello, and '''[[Wikibooks:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]]''' to [[Wikibooks]]!
Here are some tips to [[Help|help]] you get started: * To learn the wiki-markup-language syntax, see [[Help:Editing]]. * Make sure to sign your posts and comments with four tildes, like this: ~~~~ **There is a box at the top of the edit window (if javascript is enabled on your browser) that will insert it too (looks like part of a signature). This will let others know who left it, and make it easy to reply back to you. * Remember to conduct any editing experiments in the [[Wikibooks:Sandbox|sandbox]] (global to the system) or in a page on your own userspace. * Remember to use [[Commons:Main Page|Commons]] project for image uploading. * You can tell the community something about yourself in your userpage. ** You can get to this page by clicking the tab at the top of the page labeled with your registered username. * Wikibooks are open-source textbooks. ([[WB:WIW|What is Wikibooks]]). * If you are a '''Wikipedian''', see [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikipedians]] for a primer on how things work here (it's a little different). ** If you want to base your work here on materials from Wikipedia, please use [[WB:RFI]]. * If you're an '''instructor''' and plan on using Wikibooks for a class project, see [[Wikibooks:Guidelines for class projects]] * Please say hello at the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading Room]] with any questions or ideas. * Eventually, you might want to read the [[Wikibooks:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] and [[Wikibooks:Policies and guidelines|Policies and Guidelines]]. ** Help us by participating in policy and guideline creation. ** Please take a look at [[Wikibooks:Naming policy]] before starting a new book. * Remember to keep a [[Wikibooks:Neutral point of view|Neutral point of view]]. * Explore, [[Wikibooks:Be bold in updating pages|be bold in editing pages]], and have fun!
You will find more resources in [[Wikibooks:Community Portal|Community Portal]]. If you have questions, visit the [[Wikibooks:Study help desk|Study help desk]], the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading Room]], [[Wikibooks:IRC channels|IRC channel]] or [[User_talk:Panic2k4|ask me personally on my talk page]]. For site news, see the [[WB:BB|Bulletin board]]. It might be a good idea to add that page to your "[[Special:Watchlist|watchlist]]" so that you can see when any new information is posted there. You can do that by clicking the tab labeled "watch" at the top of the page.
<small><small>(This is not an automated message, I'll be watching during a time for any reply you make to it...)</small></small>
Good luck! --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|talk]]) 09:07, 16 August 2010 (UTC)
== Book medium == I've restored the [[Blender 3D: Noob to Pro/Image Portfolio]] to its previous state. The mention to use a bookmark may only make sense in special circumstances and to some users, but of more importance is that you shouldn't assume the media the book is in (there are special boxes that will prevent some information to be present on the print version). Remember not to assume the media the book is in or you will limit the portability of its content. --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|talk]]) 09:13, 16 August 2010 (UTC)

==Welcome!== [[Help:Welcome, newcomers|Welcome to Wikibooks]], a collection of open-content textbooks! You do not have to [[Special:Userlogin|log in]] to read or edit articles on Wikibooks. Creating an account is quick, free and non-intrusive, requires no personal information, and gives you many benefits, including: *The use of a username of your choice *The ability to view all your contributions via a "My contributions" link *Your own [[w:Wikipedia:User_page|user page]] *Your talk page can, if you choose, allow users to send you messages without knowing your e-mail address *Use a personal [[Special:Watchlist|watchlist]] so that you can add articles that interest you to monitor for changes. *The ability to rename pages. *The ability to [[Special:Upload|upload images]] *The ability to customize the appearance and behavior of the website *The eligibility to become an [[Help:Administrators|administrator]] *The right to be heard in votes and elections *Your IP address will no longer be visible to other users.
We hope that you choose to become a Wikibookian and '''[[Special:Userlogin|create an account]]'''. Feel free to ask me any questions you may have on my talk page. Make sure to sign your posts and comments with four tildes ('''~~~~'''), this will let others know who left it. --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|talk]]) 09:18, 16 August 2010 (UTC)

Here are some tips to [[Help|help]] you get started: * To learn the wiki-markup-language syntax, see [[Help:Editing]]. * Make sure to sign your posts and comments with four tildes, like this: ~~~~ **There is a box at the top of the edit window (if javascript is enabled on your browser) that will insert it too (looks like part of a signature). This will let others know who left it, and make it easy to reply back to you. * Remember to conduct any editing experiments in the [[Wikibooks:Sandbox|sandbox]] (global to the system) or in a page on your own userspace. * Remember to use [[Commons:Main Page|Commons]] project for image uploading. * You can tell the community something about yourself in your userpage. ** You can get to this page by clicking the tab at the top of the page labeled with your registered username. * Wikibooks are open-source textbooks. ([[WB:WIW|What is Wikibooks]]). * If you are a '''Wikipedian''', see [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikipedians]] for a primer on how things work here (it's a little different). ** If you want to base your work here on materials from Wikipedia, please use [[WB:RFI]]. * If you're an '''instructor''' and plan on using Wikibooks for a class project, see [[Wikibooks:Guidelines for class projects]] * Please say hello at the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading Room]] with any questions or ideas. * Eventually, you might want to read the [[Wikibooks:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] and [[Wikibooks:Policies and guidelines|Policies and Guidelines]]. ** Help us by participating in policy and guideline creation. ** Please take a look at [[Wikibooks:Naming policy]] before starting a new book. * Remember to keep a [[Wikibooks:Neutral point of view|Neutral point of view]]. * Explore, [[Wikibooks:Be bold in updating pages|be bold in editing pages]], and have fun!
You will find more resources in [[Wikibooks:Community Portal|Community Portal]]. If you have questions, visit the [[Wikibooks:Study help desk|Study help desk]], the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading Room]], [[Wikibooks:IRC channels|IRC channel]] or [[User_talk:Panic2k4|ask me personally on my talk page]]. For site news, see the [[WB:BB|Bulletin board]]. It might be a good idea to add that page to your "[[Special:Watchlist|watchlist]]" so that you can see when any new information is posted there. You can do that by clicking the tab labeled "watch" at the top of the page.
<small><small>(This is not an automated message, I'll be watching during a time for any reply you make to it...)</small></small>
Good luck! --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|talk]]) 10:15, 16 August 2010 (UTC)

{{#ifeq:"{{NAMESPACE}}"| "User talk"| ==Welcome!== [[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome to Wikibooks]], a collection of open-content textbooks! You don't have to [[Special:Userlogin|log in]] to read or edit articles on Wikibooks, but creating an account is quick, free and non-intrusive, requires no personal information, and gives you many benefits, including: *The use of a username of your choice * Greater security and privacy, as your IP address will be hidden from most users. * [[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|Your contributions]] will be directly attributed to you. * The use of your own [[Help:Watching pages|watchlist]] to monitor pages that you are interested in. * A personal user page and [[Help:talk page|talk page]]. * The ability to [[Help:Preferences|customize]] certain aspects of the Wikibooks interface. * The ability to rename pages. * The eligibility to become an [[Wikibooks:Administrators|administrator]]. * You become a recognized member of the Wikibooks community.
We hope that you choose to become a Wikibookian and [[Special:Userlogin|create an account]].
Feel free to ask any questions on my talk page or in the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading room]]. Be sure to sign your talk page comments with four tildes (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>).

{{edit filter navigation}} :''For the list of tags, see [[Special:Tags]].''
'''Tags''' (i.e., edit tags) are brief messages that the software automatically places next to certain edits in [[Help:Tracking changes#Page history|histories]], [[m:Help:Recent changes|recent changes]], and other special pages. The list of tags is at [[Special:Tags]]. They all come from the [[Wikibooks:Edit filter|Edit Filter]]; administrators can direct an edit filter to tag edits matching the filter.
Edits may be filtered by entering a tag in the [[Special:Contributions]] or [[Special:RecentChanges]] Tag text box.
==Use and formatting== Tags shouldn't be overly specific, instead the log should be directly used for review of edits.
For each tag, the respective appearance and description system messages can be accessed from [[Special:Tags]]. They should be created in the usual format, using a <nowiki>[[Special:Tags|Tags]]:</nowiki> prefix for the appearance.
Tags should generally not be renamed from the edit filter interface when they have already been applied to edits, as this would create a new tag. So make sure to use the correct name from the start, or change the tag description itself. Currently, there's no way to delete or reassign tags.
[[Category:Wikibooks edit filter|Tags]]
This page lists the tags that the software may mark an edit with, and their meaning. See [[Wikibooks:Tags]].
possible vandalism
This edit may be [[WB:VAND|vandalism]].
possible email address
A less experienced editor may have added an email to a content page.

revision.comment: A little topology is good for the soul. Aka, Welcome!
revision.text:
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Uncooked!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' about the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything, and changes can be made easily. Come [[Wikibooks:Reading room/General|introduce yourself]] to everyone, and let us know what [[Wikibooks:Reading room/Projects|interests you]]. If you're coming here from other Wikimedia projects, you should read [[Help:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|our primer for Wikimedians]] to get quickly up-to-speed.
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=]] '''Getting help'''
* See the '''Wikibooks [[Help:Contents|help pages]]''' for common issues, or read [[Using Wikibooks]] for a more user-friendly introduction to the project. * Remember, every edit is saved, so if you make mistakes, you can [[Wikibooks:Reverting|revert]] to an earlier version if needed. * Get help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Files must be uploaded to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]], unless they are copyrighted and need to be uploaded here under [[w:fair use|fair use]]. If you need to upload a [[Wikibooks:MEDIA#Non-free use|non-free]] file, you may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to do so. Please be sure to provide the required {{tl|information}}: a [[WB:FILES|license tag]] and source are always required; non-free files require a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}}.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[:w:Help:Edit summary|the edit summary]] and [[Help:Show preview|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[Help:Talk page|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - pages should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only becomes available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
Thanks. [[User:Thenub314|Thenub314]] ([[User talk:Thenub314|talk]]) 15:20, 16 August 2010 (UTC)
(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
PS. You might want to check out [[WB:WikiProject Mathematics]].

page.title: Programming AI with Leaf/Development/How to change Leafs name

revision.text:
==How to change the name of your Leaf==

As always you should back up your files before changing anything.

Open your '''Leaf.lisp''' and use the '''Find''' function (In LispWorks this is in the Edit menu) and search for '''"NAME YOUR ROBOT"''' with the "".
In the line below it where it says (defconstant robot "Leaf") is where you change your robots name so go ahead and take your pick, just change "Leaf" to what you want.

Save the file, compile and close it, now open your '''Speech.xml''' and add your robots name to the end of the list of names and save the file.

That's it, next time you start up Leaf your robot should respond to its new name.

{{BookCat}}

revision.text: == August 2010 == [[File:Information.svg|25px|link=]] We welcome and appreciate [[Special:Contributions/Caril Cowan|your contributions]], but some of your recent edits had to be undone. Please see [[Wikibooks:What is Wikibooks|What is Wikibooks?]] to learn more about what contributions are beneficial to Wikibooks. Wikibooks is not a collection of links; nor should it be used as a platform for advertising or promotion, and doing so is contrary to the goals of this project. Because Wikibooks uses nofollow tags, external links do not alter search engine rankings. If you feel a link or content should be added to a page, please discuss it on the page's talk page before reinserting it. Please take a look at the [[Wikibooks:Welcome|welcome]] page to learn more about contributing to this project. Thank you. '''—[[User:I-20|I-20]][[User talk:I-20|the highway]]''' 22:22, 16 August 2010 (UTC)

== Features ==
Features of fluxbox include:
* Stacking windows * Windows can be grouped together using tabbed windows * Window decorations include titlebars and window borders * Configurable titlebars have minimize, maximize and close buttons * Windows can be minimized to a dock * The dock provides support for windowmaker dock applications
{{BookCat}}

[[Image:Openbsd37withjwm.png|thumb|200px|On OpenBSD]] '''JWM''' (Joe's Window Manager) is a lightweight stacking window manager written by Joe Wingbermuehle. JWM is written in C and uses only Xlib at a minimum. * License: GPLv2 * Type: Stacking * Website: [http://www.joewing.net/programs/jwm/ www.joewing.net/programs/jwm] == Features == *Xft *Xinerama *FriBidi *The Shape extension *Like Windows 98 *WM spec hints support *PNG, JPG and XPM support
{{BookCat}}

Imagine, if you will, some monkeys. Unlike the common stereotype of "monkey see, monkey do", these monkeys are rebellious, contrarian monkeys. Each one always do the *opposite* of what it sees the monkey in front of it doing. When one monkey stands up, the monkey who sees it insists on laying down. When one monkey lays down, the monkey who sees it insists on standing up.
Now place 4 of these monkeys, one at each of the 4 corners outside a skyscraper, so each one can only see the one monkey in front of him. When a prankster comes along and tickles the first monkey until the monkey rolls on the floor laughing (ROFL), the next monkey sees that and insists on standing tall. The following monkey diagonally opposite the laughing monkey can't see the laughing monkey through the building, but he can see the standing monkey on the corner in front of him, so he insists on laying down. The 4th monkey sees the laying monkey and insists on standing tall.
After the pranksters leave the first monkey, that monkey sees the 4th monkey standing tall and insists on remaining laying on the floor. We can summarize the situation as * low High low High.
Later the pranksters find the second monkey standing tall, and tickle that monkey until the monkey rolls on the floor laughing. After the pranksters leave and the dust settles, a similar but not identical situation occurs. We summarize the new situation as * High low High low.
What happens if the building has 6 sides? Or 100 sides?
Next the pranksters do something even more diabolical. They place some of these monkeys at one of these "modern" architecture skyscrapers has 5 corners, and place 5 monkeys, one at each of the 5 corners. While the pranksters are tickling the first monkey, we can summarize the situation as * low High low High low But as soon as the pranksters tire of it and wander off, the tickled monkey sees the monkey laying in front and insists on standing up: * High High low High low. Pretty soon the standing monkey that was watching the monkey be tickled notices that monkey is now standing up, so this standing monkey insists on laying down. * High low low High low. The process continues around the building * High low High High low * High low High low low * High low High low High * low low High low High * low High High low High * low High low low High * low High low High High * low High low High low * High High low High low * High low low High low and so on. Even though the pranksters have long gone, the monkeys keep jumping up and laying down, over and over again, indefinitely.
The 5 monkeys in a ring around this building form a kind of ring oscillator.
There are a huge variety of other things we can use instead of monkeys. Electronic inverters must be fed a little electronic power, but that costs far less than the feed for a bunch of monkeys.
There are conceptually 3 parts to a ring oscillator: * signal restoration: when the input of one stage is even a little bit low, the output goes practically all the way High; when the input is even a little bit High, the output goes practically all the way low. * time delay: when the input suddenly goes high-to-low, it takes a short (but non-zero) amount of time before the next stage "notices" and goes low-to-high. * a feedback loop, so that the output of the final stage is seen by the first stage, the output of the first stage is seen by the second stage, and so on.
In practice, the "time delay" part may not be a separate physical part, but merely the inherent light-speed delay in information passing from one location to some other physical location.
{{BookCat}}
